reviews.review: Everything about Istanbul is historical. I am amazed at all the history in this city alone. Every area has some sort of history. It is a truly amazing city.

RICH CULTURE AND HISTORY. By any chance, if you get to Istanbul, stay in the town district of Sultanahmet and the culture and the real feel of Turkey will come to life as you begin to live it, eat it and sleep it! Must enjoy the history behind, which is mind boggling!
Beuty at its best. Instambul was the best location I have ever seen in my life. The old historical part is awesome to spend a full day because ita beuty worth a full day visit.
Many interesting places to see and do. Don't miss this unique area.. Very interesting place to visit. There are many places to visit and things to do, all within walking distance.
Must see in your life time. The historical Istanbul downtown is a must see in your life time. Don;t miss the Blue Mosque, Topkapi, Hagia Sophia and the Basilica Cisterna
That's the area !. If you have one day in Istanbul, that's the area you might spend time during your visit ! There are also nice cozy restaurants you could choose at the neighbourhood.
Must visit!. Like everything in Istanbul-Constantinople must be seen! Every rock in this area has seen so much history! And we, humans, must feel the history by stepping on those rocks.

Wonderful People & Wonderful Oriental Life Style and History & Relaxing Cat City!. Enriching meeting point of East and West, full of great hospitality and dialogue between religions and cultures! Warm people made us feel so safe all the time! You'll love all the warm hearted people of this international beautiful city, which has millions of stories happened in Oriental history, delicious food, relaxing hamam baths, beautiful art and handicrafts at Bazars. I greatly appreciated how people took care of their cats (and dogs). Also suits for Lovers of Sun and Sea! It is a pity that many tourists have avoided Turkey, I would encourage you to visit and enjoy life of Istanbul despite of all incertainty made by news. There will be so much more to experience!

One of the most photogenic cities in the world. But very hilly and cobbled.. You cannot but help falling in love with Istanbul. The views are breath-taking. Great food. Friendly people. Plenty to see and do. Get an Istanbulcard which operates as a pre-pay ticket for metro, trams, buses and ferries. Explore the upper reaches of the Bosporus, beyond Besiktas and Ortakoy, and eat on the waterside on the Asia side. A great city for walking but very hilly and many historic areas cobbled. Plenty to see away from the tourists.

One of the most beautiful cities. One of my favorite places in the world. The people are so polite and nice, the hotels we have stayed in could not have been better. Mosques and museums are so beautiful and well-kept. (Just be aware that some knucklehead tour guides will have their "laser light" pointing at ceilings & such, when you're trying to take photos and get a green streak in your shots). The food is amazing, from their typical cuisine, to the wonderful Turkish Delight (which is addicting!). It's really easy to get around the city on their little tram, or a taxi. (Make sure the taxi driver uses a meter so you don't get stiffed). There have been some horrific things going on in Istanbul recently, and I hope we have the chance to return again.

Living Dreams. Historical Peninsula of Istanbul is a must place to visit. Topkapi Palace, Sultanahmet Mosque (as known as Blue Mosque), Basilica Cistern, Hagia Sofia and of course "The Grand Bazaar". One day would be enough to see everywhere but not in too details. Especially Grand Bazaar is just huge and biggest old bazaar in the world. Highly recommended.

Thousands of years of history. Old Istanbul is a fascinating journey back in time reflected European and Middle Eastern history. There is no need to take guided tours - the Internet has plenty of background and the city is walking friendly - provided you are moderately fit.

Old Istanbul is bustling with women in burkas. The Saudis and conservative women are much in evidence in old Istanbul. It is easy to feel the influence of modern Islam as you see the sights. Sometimes disquieting but never fearful. Conservative dress is suggested to somewhat blend in.
Nice place to visit . You need to visit this places with at least 5 hours of walking and interested places to visit , blue mosque is the best place to visit
bosfor. getting on sea buses passing through bosfor which is the border between european and asian part of istanbul and feeding birds is very attractive.

An amazing view of European/Ottoman/Asian history. Just a wonderful way to get a BIGGER sense of where Europe and Asia meet. A fascinating city, with a fascinating culture, in an important place. There is so much to do and see -- Ottoman history, Turkish history, an incredible setting, spice markets, leather markets, tiles/porcelain/pottery, boats that link Europe and Asia, incredible foodVisit, take time, walk and talk. I can't wait to go back!Tom W
Amazing city. Istanbul was an amazing city to visit - everyone should go there. There is so much to see and so much history.

Awesome!. It was a great experience to see those historical areas. The buildings, designs, architectures were magnificent. The locations of the areas really explained how amazing this place was left unattended but preserve and well maintained by the government.

You dont need to get out from this place to enjoy Istanbul. The historic area which basically is Sultanahmet district is a compact area containing the major attractions Istanbul is famous for. Historical monuments spanning milleniums like the Topkapi Palace, Hagia Sophia, the Blue Mosque, the little Hagia Sophia, so on and so forth are located in this area. Book a room at one of the many hotels in this area and you dont need to leave this district. My stay of 4 nights wasn't enough to cover all of the attractions here to be honest. And I estimate I would need another 4 nights for Galata area which is a mix of history and fun.
Nice holiday city Istanbul. We visited as tourist having varied interest group but all enjoyed trip and are looking forward to visit again.

Needs a coat of paint but east meets west. Was impressed and wanted to take my granddaughters but life there is too unsafe so shall take my granddaughters but may go alone.I flew Turkish air but prefer to another line due to a endangered country.
must visit in Istanbul . if you travel to Istanbul you should not miss the hestoric areas .. where you can live the scent of the past...
Great tourist city for walking!. Put on your walking shoes and go!!! Lots of shopping, street food, restaurants, sites and photo opportunities. Enjoy!!
Must be in eluded in any visit. Historic, interesting, awe inspiring, beautiful - a must see spot on a tour of the city. Not to be seen in isolation

From Minarets to Markets, Mosques to Museums. The Historic Areas of Istanbul, (or ancient Constantinople - I always preferred that name), is a group of sites within the city, many of which are UNESCO listed.Famous landmarks, top experiences, spectacular scenery and unique shopping encounters, spread across two continents - Europe and Asia.Some of the more popular include;The Sultanahmet district. Topkapı Palace- home of the Ottoman sultans for hundreds of years, overlooking the Golden Horn and the Bosphorus strait.The Byzantine Hagia Sophia and museum- dating back to the 6th century, containing tombstones, old baptistery remnants and rare Christian mosaics from the 12th century.Sultan Ahmed Mosque- internally adorned with countless thousands of blue tiles, spectacular, both inside and out.The open-air, Roman-era Hippodrome- where the 3500 year old Egyptian Obelisk of Theodosius stands, carved from pink granite.The Grand Bazaar- one of the largest and oldest covered markets in the world with thousands of shops and dating back to 1461.The defensive stone walls of Constantinople, the list goes on...

Visited Haga Sofya, Blue Mosque and Topkapi palace, as well as Galatica tower.. Blue mosque and Hippodrome are worth a visit. Wear longs for men (or you will be made to wear a skirt) and head scarf and closed shoulders and ankle length garment for women. Haga Sofya is impressive, especially the second floor frescos. Topkapi palace a must, especially the pavillions and princes circumcision room (best tiles in the entire palace in my opinion) and do visit the kitchen and watch and armoury displays. We were fortunate that there were small crowds due to the fear factor. Must visit the Harram, although I prefer the lighter palaces of Europe.

Great place to wander. We wandered around the various streets. Spent time in a cafe and drank Turkish coffee and Turkish delight of course. The people were fantastic and very welcoming. Prices for tourist are great and the same for general public. When you are there don't forget to go to the spice market, colourful and fragrant, it's hard not to shop.
This is the best place. History could be seen every place and the more you travel the more you could get to see the beautiful buildings around

Nice. The place is charming, we took the metro to haltch station and we arrived , very nice place to go but if you are with young children, you will need to walk some distance to see the area . I noticed that shopping is cheaper in this area ,

Everywhere you encounter history.... Certainly on the European site, there are so many beautiful historical sites, so it is kind of difficult to speak of 'the Historic Area': go to Hagia Sofia, continue with the Blue Mosque, Topkapi, the Basilica Cisterne, visit the Archaeological Museum or go a little further to the 1453 Panoramic Museum, close to the old walls. Everywhere something to discover!
Ideal area to base yourself. We stayed in a boutique hotel in the historic area of Istanbul and were not disappointed as we could walk to nearly everything we wanted to see.
ancient. i went to most old places of istabul with my wife in our honeymoon and it was excelent for us and a good memory to review
Good place for a walk. At night I highly recommend a walk in that area. You will find shops and coffee places open late at night.

Turkland Travel - Ozden Basak. Several years ago I came through Istanbul on a cruise ship and was only there for a couple of days. Unfortunately, as I was leaving one of my bags was lost. About 6 months later I received a phone call from Ozden Basak in San Francisco who was there doing lectures across America on Persian/Oriental rugs. He was in possession of my lost luggage and offered to bring it to me in Chicago on his way back to Istanbul. Needless I was thrilled when he stopped by my home to deliver my bag. We had just had our floors re-finished and I told Ozden I was in the market for a rug. Next think I knew, he ask his men to bring about 15 rugs up to my apt. and I wound up buying two gorgeous rugs! When he was leaving, Ozden told me that in addition to dealing in rugs, if I ever came back to Turkey to look him up because he owned Turkland Travel Agency in Istanbul and he would love to show off his city. Seven years later I was planning once again to visit this magical city and found his business card. I wrote him and he immediately responded. Over the course of about 4 or 5 weeks we conversed back and forth and Ozden planned an amazing itinerary for me while there. We were met at the airport and were transported via a Mercedes to our hotel room. The next day Ozden assigned the best guide in Turkey, Mr. Istanbul himself, Metin Yilmaz to show us around from 9:00 a.m. til 5:00 p.m. for the next two days. Everything was taken care of with precision detail.....the guide, the transportation, and the meals. Ozden even took time out of his busy day to joiin us for lunch one day. He could not have been more attentive, knowledgeable, and kind. Ozden even remarked that he no longer considered us clients but friends....and it certainly showed. If ever you have the opportunity to visit Turkey, I hope you will contact Ozden Basak at Turkland Travel. You will not be disappointed. I think he's the best travel agent in all of Turkey. Highly recommended!!!
Great . venturing further out I feel I was seeing the real Istanbul and really enjoyed using the metro underground and ferries to get there.

Impromptu tour. Ismail put together a tour of some of the fabulous places like Chora Church, Suleymaniye Mosque, Galata Tower and places for a great lunch and tea in a garden overlooking the Golden horn! It was fantastic!
Rich of History. Istanbul has many historical areas worth to see, it has the legend of the old history with elegancy.
An extraordinary city. Istanbul has become one of my favourite cities to visit, loads to see and do. High lights would be the blue mosque, palace and walking along the Bosporus
Something everywhere.. Istanbul is a must. There is so much to see and do. The people are friendly and the cost is fare. Food choice is excellent from fast food to fine dinning.
Well kept!. In my opinion there is no other city in the world with so diverse historical sites, from Greek to Roman, from Roman to Byzantine, from Byzantine to Seljuk and form Seljuk to Ottoman.

The old town is not really worth to see. The buildings aren't anything special and the streets are really narrow and untidy. Choose the area around Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosque instead.
Of course the term "historic areas" can also refer to them. But I mean the old town with the wooden buildings with the "historic areas of istanbul".
Blew my expectations. Beautiful and quite. Great history. A must for all to visit. Lots to see. Central and easy access for everyone.

The most extraordnary city that you can visit. Places such as the galata Tower, the Blue Mosque,Boats through the Bosphorus, Galata Bridge, Taksim Square, Hagia Sophia Museum, are some of the wonders that you can appreciate in Istanbul. Enjoy them!!!

Fabulous Mosques and visitor attractions. We visited the Blue Mosque and other visitor attractions in the area,including the most famous diamond in the world. Although very busy we did not feel crammed in and after a little queuing saw the Blue Mosque.They are all absolutely fabulous and well worth the visit.Avoid going to the covered market in Istanbul as it is thoroughly commercialised with all the authenticity of typical Istanbul masked by very pushy street traders.I wouldn't mind this , but what they are selling is overpriced rubbish. Avoid at all costs or go expecting the worst.Istanbul is a modern city quickly vanishing into westernisation, which is a shame. Go on the river on a boat trip to see how the real Istanbul is, and visit both sides of the river. The difference is very surprising!!!

History revisited. Visiting the historical areas in Istanbul was the highlight of our trip. Whichever direction you look at, you will find things which are a lesson in history. The old is well preserved and you can clearly see the difference between the new and old and they coexist very well together. The blue mosque, the spice market and other important places are situated in the here. Do plan a whole day/ sufficient time. You won't be disappointed.

A day well spent in Sultanamet. One of the main reasons of coming to Istanbul had been the historical places we get to see. With so much contribution to the field of architecture, trade, culinary arts and apparel of the Ottoman empire.it was marvellous to see how well preserved all the relics and buildings from the Ottoman empire. We took the guided tour of hagia Sophia, the Blue mosque and saw the Grand Bazaar in one day. and one day we kept reserved just for the Topkapi palace. Having seen so many Turkish historical plays I could feel and breath each character I had seen on t.v.

Fascinating but a lot of hassle. There are so many wonderful buildings to be discovered just walking around the streets, that a visit could be a pleasure.However there is a lot of hassle from people pretending to be helpful or friendly then trying to get you into their shop or asking fir payment.Nevertheless their seem to be some genuinely helpful people but we were put off visiting the Bazaars because we anticipated too much bother.

The old & the new. Fascinating city, which was the settlement of many civilizations. The last civilizations dating back to BC Greeks, Byzantines, Romans, Ottomans and the Turkish republic. This city is an open-air museum full of history and interesting palaces to visit. İstanbul is on the north west side of Anatolia, a land where civilization begun. One of a life time experience. A truly remarkable palace. Must visit.

Incredible Blend of the Middle East and Europe. I can't say enough about Istanbul. The sights are amazing and, if one is a student of history, the Byzantine Empire and the Ottoman Empire come alive. The other thing is the voices and smells. Obviously, this isn't western Europe; but, it's still fun to walk around where you hear very little English, French, German, etc. but you do hear a lot of Turkish, Slavic languages including Russian, and Arabic. It's also enlightening to see the contrast between most Turks (who are 95% Muslim) and the Arab visitors. While Turkish men and women dress the same as in Rome or Barcelona, the Arab men feel no compunctions about wearing casual pants and light shirts while the women with them are dressed head-to-toe in black, drapey clothes and only thing visible on the women from Saudi (I asked) is their eyes.
Istanbul - my love!. It's been nearly a week when i came back home, but I'm still in Istanbul in my mind. Everywhere you can find history that mixes with modern.

Lovely and historic. Hi this is a nice place for couples and families. Lots of history and interesting places to visit. Loved the blue dome mosque and Sophia museum. Both are very educational and beautiful representations of history and islamic architecture which I love. Please go dressed modestly to mosque as it's only respectful to do so.

Three days well spent. It's a nice place to discover. The more you walk more historical sites you see. Gift shops in every corner and some have nice things to buy.Prices are not fixed and can be lowered to some extent.Tram line passes through the area so you can go around fast if u don't like to walk or have specific place in mind.

A great place to visit.. Istanbul is a great place to visit, its richness in culture and heritage along with friendly and helpful people makes Istanbul unique. There is so much to see and visit, you can spend days (if not weeks) and every corner has its historical importance, the Sultan Ahmet sqaure, the blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Grand Bazaar, TopKapi Palace, spice market to name very few. An amazing trip with lasting memories and unforgetable views. A great value for money, the prices are very reasonable and

Relieving History in this Great City!. Very interesting places to see of historical importance. Greatness in this city where Europe and Asia meet. Architectural wonders in the different Mosques abundant in this city. A Bosphusrus river boat ride is a welcome experience to see the city scape of the city. 3-4 days in Istambul is sufficient to see all the major city sites. Will come back again.
any visit without old town is incomplete. you cannot say you visited Istanbul without seeing the old town. blue mosque, grand bazaar, st. Sophia and more are all in this part of the city. a must-see.

You can not feel tired or bored. Walking in Istanbul Historic Areas you can not feel tired or bored. Every thing around you cover you with happy feelings. You can find every improtant thing you need around you.
Excellent. Turkey is a beautiful historical place .the best view we got was from the cruise . We did not know what to do see or take photographs .all the five star hotels lined up .
Galata District should be at the top. This place is the heart of the history of Istanbul from Ottoman times and earlier. Roman houses still stands and beautiful

MUST SEE PLACE IN ISTANBUL. The historic areas of Istanbul features The Blue Mosque, St. Sophia, Topkapı Palace, TheBasilica Cistern, Grand Bazaar, Spice Bazaar, Suleymaniye Mosque, etc. These are the must visit places if you are in Istanbul. They are situated at the old town.
Sultanahmed. I did enjoy the time on the Sultanahmed as usually but Taksim area was a littlebit different like before, you must to see it.
Historic Area with cultural views. We went to the historic areas of Istanbul and discover all lovely arts of culture during both the Islamic Ruling and before

A very CLASS atmosphere!. Whenever i find a free time i visit the historic areas of İstanbul. Topkapı Palacae, The Blue Mosque,Hagia Sophia, Basilica Cistern, Sulaimaniah Mosque, Islamic Arts Museums, The Museum of the History of Islamic Science and Technology, Grand Bazaar, Eminonu, Sirkeci, Gulhane Garden, Galata Tower and area, Karakoy, Fatih, Beyazit, more and more..Entegred the modern life but you still can feel that class and various and valuable atmosphere there. Must see!

Interesting historical area. The historic area of Istanbul is not as well known as the great mosques, but it's definitely just as interesting.There are incredibly many exciting things to look at. Set aside a coup days for the trip.If you do not have much time, so it is also interesting just to take a walk in the area to experience the atmosphere.
Esnaf olmasa. Esnaf olmasa harika bir yer, esnaf cok simarik ve rahatsiz edici.The area is amazing. Just be careful with the shopkeepers. They are quite spoiled and annoying.

Instanbul Tour. I've had the pleasure to travel with friends through this AMAZING city in September. The weather was perfect. The city and its mix of modern life and ancient history was both enchanting and captivating. The food was absolutely delicious. The people were oh so friendly and greeted you with a smile wherever you went. It's best to stick within a group and not to head off on your own. Transportation was easy. We loved using the very efficient train. Be sure to first confirm costs of taxis before getting in. Of course with being a tourist, tips are always welcomed.We had the privilege of being lead by a very knowledgeable and professional tour guide. He took the time to interact with everyone in our group and made us feel welcome. He was always available to answer any questions. When we felt like venturing out on our own he provided us with great recommendations.What made him stand out from other tour guides is the fact that he spent all his time with our group. He had all meals with us and spent any free time telling us about life in Istanbul. We were fascinated and captivated by his stories.The tour was hassle-free and we were on time for all our planned trips. Just make sure that you are on time too.If you're looking for a great English speaking tour guide with a great sense of humor, please contact Murat Ozkan at Murattouristguide@gmail.com.Enjoy your trip!

Nice. For me it doesn't had alot to enjoy since I have grown up in the same cultural country with the similar theme, but I'm sure for Europeans and Americans, it would be more interesting and enjoyable.
So much to see. A wonderful and historic place. So much to see,well worth a visit. There are lots of palaces, museums and mosques.
Good Place to Visit. If you are history lover so get up early and go out for visit this place is really historic like open museum for who is interest to visit

Be wary of the salesmen. The sights of Istanbul are wonderful but, because of the reduced tourism (due to the country's current political unrest) the salesmen are very aggressive. We attempted to be polite our first day and got sucked into two different carpet stores - a waste of their time and ours since we were not going to buy anything. The store owners are extremely congenial and non-threatening - but your time could be better spent amongst the antiquities. From day 2 on, sadly, we were forced to be somewhat rude and simply ignore anyone who spoke to us in English so that we could get to our museum destinations.
Amazing Place To Visit. A history buffs dream the place is heaving with historical sites everywhere with a crossroad of civilizations the place is a treasure trove. Fantastic place to visit.
History!!. Istanbul has a lot to offer to the history lovers. The historic area is an open museum for travelers.
Enjoyed the walk around the fountain area.. A lot of history there. Walking allows one to see more, from the ground up. Each day was a pleasant surprise.

Cultural. It is a different place, so many interesting places to visit and a lot of culture to learn, we visited the Grand Bazar where we found a lot of interesting thing to buy.
The city is clean, the is many people on the streets and visitors as well.
execellent efforts. everything was clean and helpful,especially the transportation in the central area of Istanbul .they restored most places marvelously .

Amazing visit thru history. Aykut arranged a walking tour in the neighbourhood of sulhanahmet square. We started our day from Hagia sofia, then walk thru sultanahmet square upto hippodrome & then visited basilica cistern. Our next destination was topkapi palace museum including its harem section & the our religious heritage including belongings of Hazrat Ibrahim, Hazrat Yusuf, Hazrat Musa, Hazrat Muhammad, 4 Kaliphs, Hazrat Fatima & many more. A wonderful day with Aykut who explains the history related to the buildings & things over there. Our next day, started with visit to Sulaimania masjid. Next, we taken bosphorus cruise with sight seeing on asian & european sides. Then we drive to the Camlica hills having our lunch there. Then we visited ortakoy & offers prayers at ortakoy masjid & also visted Rumeli fort. On day 4, we visited Hazrat Abu Ayub Ansari tomb & masjid, Fetih museum, city wall, Dolmabahce palace, istiqlal street, taqseem square.
Nostalgic Trip in History. Magnificent Historical Buildings, with a charming views over the Mediterranean. A must visit in Istanbul. Do not miss the nice food restaurant and the Boutques.

Sultanahmet square. Istanbul is a large city spread across two continents - Europe and Asia and has been attracting visitors for hundreds of years. Not only are there historically significant places to see there is also delicious Turkish food to eat, spectacular scenery to view and unique shopping experiences to be had.
Istanbul old city is an area not to miss. Very beautiful city in all means. A lot of history with beautiful weather and good food. What more to ask?
Well worth the visit. I spent a week in Istanbul and went to many of the buildings in the he historic district. I loved the attractions, food and the people of this great city.

Picture perfect at every angle - despite winter weather.. Stayed in Old Istanbul on a 3 day stop over and found the Historic areas just brilliant. Ayasofya, Top Kepi, Sultanahmet, both the the covered and spice markets and the bosphorus all within walking distance of my hotel (Blue Sapphire - also spelt Safia on the board outside).

Just get lost. Istanbul is full of historical places. One of my favorite ways to discover a city is to get lost. Just walk around without caring about time, ask locals for places they use to drink and eat, sat down at parks where the locals resting and feel like you belong to this place. Because Istanbul has many attractions to offer, I would suggest to study which of the historical Area fits with your expectations in the first hand.
Good. Just look around & give your eyes the most pleasant & interesting sights it can ever come across! Beautiful
The streets are filled with wonderful sights and sounds. We walked hours and hours a day and were just fascinated and uplifted by the architecture and history all around us.
History in each step. This area is a must see if you travel to Istanbul allow at least 1 day 2 if you can to really see all the area has to offer
Waw enjoy every place. The mid of the world where history has been made. Every spot has it's own story and place at the memory of the history.

Beauty everywhere. And cats. If you like culture, go see it. If you like beautiful buildings,also go see it. But mostly, if you like cats, definitely go see it. They are so many everywhere! I recommend maybe having a walking tour the first day and then just discovering by yourself. I had some friends walking me around the first days, but then I just went randomly, enjoyed the cafes, the souvenir shops, visited a mosque or two. I simply experienced the city. It is indeed lovely and people are very nice if you get lost.

Blue Mosque and historic sights. Stay in the historic centre of Istanbul , the tram is the best way to get around and very affordable , buy a tram card and load a few local dollars on it . couples traveling together get a discounted fare also. all the historic sights are within a short tram / walk the current conflict aside we were there in 2015 and always felt very safe and friendly locals
too expensive,no sightseeing. too expensive for no sightseeing.it is a fault .no metro map for famous placeswrong way for future.

City is really HUGE. Istanbul is a bustling city that attracts tourist from all over the world. Why?Well, for many it can be considered the "center of the world": a bridge between Europe and the EastHistory and Culture everywhere (also food).Be careful about so many tourist scams.
good for art lovers. art and history lovers can find more here , but beautiful please to see and amazed , like the architecture

Awesome area to visit. Beautiful area, I had a local guiding me around, which is highly advisable, It's very easy to get lost in the city.
I crossed to the other side of Istanbul via Kadikoy, also very easy and straightforward to find tickets :)
Go early / you will not have enough time to view it all, but going early helps!
Takes you back in time. It is all together a different experience roaming around in the historic areas of Istanbul. It gives you a feel of the history.
One of my favorite cities. NOTHING more relaxing than taking a two hour walk in old istanbul with its views, flavors and smells.
Best city in the world number one. To many times l visute istanbul but only think l should say best city in the world ever never forget it istanbullll.......

a must. istanbul is a very beautiful city except traffic. especially bosphorus and historic sites all worth to see. ayasofya, sultanahmet, galata tower, all magnificent, I recommended to take a tour because traffic and transportation may be complicated for a tourist.
Stepping back in time. When I travel I like to see things that are hard to imagine what it must be like from afar. Istanbul was like stepping back in time. The people and sites did not disappoint!

great relaxing afternoon. this was fun fun fun - really explored eveything
just do it - its free and stimulating
and many local enjoy chatting!

I wish I could live there!. I went to this city 4 times and I liked it better every time. Everything there is amazing: the people, the food, the contrasts in architecture, all the history hidden behind every wall and street.... It's just astonishing. The options are infinite and you will never get bored there.

Eid vacation break. Great location to stay at the many boutique hotels withing walking distance of all the historic attractions. Vehicular access to these parts are limited making for a peaceful neighbourhood.

Neil Williamson . Lots to see and do. Well worth planning your day. So much to see and it is a very big city to get round. However public transport is excellent and the Turkish people very friendly and helpful.
The Galata Tower. I found the view quite mundane. You can see the docks and all the ramshackle houses all arouns from a fairly unimpressive height!

Stunning old city. There is alot to soak in so if you want to see everything make sure you are there for a minimum of 3 days.One day should be solely dedicated to the shops, there is a vast amount of choice so best to know what you are really looking for....best leather for miles around.
Monuments are spectacular.

Sultan Ahmet - Historic - Section of Istanbul. I have visited Istanbul during the last three Summers and stayed in various hotels in the European side. The most historic treasurers are to be found in the area named after one of the Ottoman Sultans called Ahmed. Ahmet as a Sultan doesn't appear to be a significant ruler but where he lived has a great deal of historical values, thus brings in many thousands of tourists into Istanbul. You could find a restaurant with see thru floors under which historical Roman artifacts can be viewed while you are enjoying a Turkish Kabab Dinner !!! A fascinating experience. A must place to visit is Aya Sofia Museum right across from the 4 Seasons Hotel. Get there early in the morning 'cause there are long lines of tourists just like you. If you are a big spender get reservations at the 4 Seasons for about a $1K a night. Otherwise, try Biz Cevahir Hotel a few blocks down at about $300./night. However, we discovered that "The Berks Hotel/Guest House", right next to the 4 Seasons, is the most desirable location for their most friendly service and a very reasonable financial cost(under $200.) which includes breakfast with smiles. Some times you even get a free glass of red wine from Ahmet, spouse of owner/manager Yesim. Hope you enjoy your next trip to Istanbul. May the Force be with you !! U. B. (One Knube) Bakker, Prof.of International Partnership, PSU

Comfortable area to stay. Been an international area for years.. Stayed at an Airbnb in the Galata area. The history in this area is palpable. Every evening walked the streets, using the Galata Tower as a landmark. Many tasty restaurants. View from Galata tower at sunset is breathtaking. This area has for years had international residents, so very open to tourists. Delightful.

Great history . Istanbul is full of history. Sultanahmet district is very rich in history. Start from Ayasofya to Sultanahmet mosque then columns of elder generation. Many palaces, olden trains, traditional Turkish Hamam and hundreds of others. The only point is you have to have time.

Treasures Of Turkey. Excellent country to visit and so much history Turkey offers. Visited Topkapi, Sultan Ahmed Mosque, Grand Bazzar,Dolmabahce Palace these are few areas we have visited. The people are fantastic very friendly and helpful. I suggest you forget about dieting....the food is superb..
Plenty of places to wonder. Grab a map and go for a wonder, plenty to see. Also plenty of places to eat, and shop, but be ready to haggle.

you want to know the oldest. the oldest part of Istanbul is GALATA the narrow allies with lot of shops ,you never get bored there and never get tired even from walking in the snaky narrow roads ,you want to see Istanbul go to GALATA and get nice souvenirs .

Wander Istanbul. I spent 3 days wandering alone throughout the old town and various mosques and parks in Istanbul. Public transport was safe and easy. Many low cost cruise tours will take you through the Bosporus, Golden Horn and Sea of Marmara all the way to the Black Sea. There are drop off tours of beautiful mansions and view points like Pierre Loti Hill. Wander through the bazaar - it will take you a while - and listen to the competitive nature of the barkers. Try a local hole in the wall for lunch and watch your choice grilled in front of you. The chef will come sit as you enjoy his creation. Stay in the historic area of town to get the feel of the city.
Lose yourself in a different world. Off Istiklal street, you can lose youself off the beaten track on one side of the inlet and then immerse yourself in the spice market and bazaars.
Blue Masjid. I visited blue masjid with my friends on Aug 2015, it's most historical place in Istanbul it's located at sulthanamet,it's most beautiful historical area in Istanbul.
Great. A must see place. No need to book a guide and the history can be easily found on internet. Already 40 TR is a bit more as entrance fee. But worth visiting
Beautiful City. Istambul is definetely one of the most beautiful cities of the world, no matter where you look at, you 'll find something pretty or interesting. You just can't go wrong here!

What a beauty. Istanbul is all about History. So not visiting Historic areas is worthless going to Istanbul. This was my first visit to Istanbul and was glad that i did visit the Historic places for which Istanbul is known.Its a must do in Istanbul.
A world city. It is worth to see Istanbul's historic part,visiting the palace, mosques, walking on the streets like locals and shopping from old bazaar, and more ....
HISTORY. So much, so interesting, so amazing. The history here, just really awesome. So much much to see. So much to take in. A very amazing area

Dive into History!!. Being a city of a very rich history, Istanbul serves the appetite for ost of the history lovers and followers. Especially, the Sultanahmet, Fatih and Taksim areas are full of history. Since this city has been under the influence of Greeks, Muslims and Christians so you will easily find a lot of archaeological sites, some mesmerizing mosques and a few beautiful churches too. In short, this city is a paradise for history lovers. Before visiting, one can research online which places to visit and how to visit.
Valuable. This is everything i wanna see and feel in istanbul ... Sultanahmet.. Galata.. the walls of Constantinople and etc... A MUST for history lovers
Best of Istanbul. I'm all about the history of a city. When coming please visit Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, and Galata Tower. These are a must in this city.
wealth of history. simply amazing city, even in these difficult times. from the tower to cruises there is no much to do, 1 week is never enough
amazing. this is history!! worth the trip and the traffic.. Come see history alive today. 20 million people live here. just make sure it's a holiday or traffic is crazy
worth to visit. Historic areas in ISTANBUL worth to visit as you will feel the history once you are there especially Aya Sofia and the blue Mosque in addition to the Maiden Tower and Galata Tower

Istanbul is a treasure chest of history. There is no other city on earth which is as exciting as Istanbul with respect to the historical character and relics it has. It has bene the capital for three different empires and cultures over the centuries. Every corner of the city is a reminder of this glamorous past. Although not necessarily as appreciated by the locals I think it is a gem that has to be seen and experienced over and over again.I would recommend Topkapi Palace, Dolmabahce Palace and the Galata Tower to start with.

Walking tour of Historic Istanbul. This is a very walkable city and if you need or want, the public transit is convenient and cheap. Every block offers another picture of history. Elaborate marble buildings and ornate mosaics everywhere.

A beautiful city to visit. So many places to visit with historical values and many of them are easily accessible by public transportation. Food and drinks were amazing, as I can't get enough of their Doner Kebab as my taste buds were flooded with combination of seasonings. Just have to watch out for personal belongings and shoe cleaner "accidentally" dropping their brush. Despite the recent tragedies that affected this city, I'm planning on returning to explore more.

Almost all the old side of Istanbul is Historic area. If you ever visit Turkey, Istanbul is the place and the old part of the city is where you need to stay. Almost all the old side of Istanbul is Historic area. You will be in the middle of every where. In every hotel lobby area there is several flyer, look around and know what you need to see and ask the hotel the make your reservation. They will pick you up and show around. Most of them including land, sea and nice meal. It is fast tour and informative.

Great people, great history. Istanbul was absolutely a gem. I had a lovely time in the city. The Hagia Sophia is truly a wonder to be experienced. I feel very bad for the country given the current times. I would go back if I could afford it and if I had time off. Great and helpful people, amazing food, amazing country.
Beautiful, vibrating and heartedly. We loved our stay. Strolling around, exploring the cultural sites and the sweet tiny coffee shops - fantastic.
Istanbul. A beautiful cosmopolitan city one should not miss in their lifetime! Visited through a Singapore Travel Package Tours and simply love it.
old town. Istanbul is a historical city. You can find various museums to see. Nearby lots of good restaurants.
Our trip to Istanbul. Arrived after the recent attack, no issues. Thought the place was quiet but place is lovely, well worth the visit

Istanbul's best. There is so much to see. Give yourself time and stop and look at whatever is happening around you. Be polite when refusing an offer to purchase by a local. They will go away and not bother you again.
Bosporustour, Galata. The Bosporustour with the public Boat was very good. But I recommend to go back by Bus from the last Stop

A pleasent city walk with lots of unique views. We had lots of walk during 4 days of staying in Istanbul;

Looking at old buildings, seeing tracks of rails on some streets, old houses with their hand made marks, replanish your sight by these views nad take photos to keep .

Magnificent!!!. You have to put historic istanbul area in to your bucket list. I don't even remember how many times i have been there but let me tell you this. Every time i went there , I explored something new. Its like deepless well....
Class. Great hıstorıcal city İSTANBUL... Big historical museum İSTANBUL...best city in the world.. You must visit
water and Medusa. A fantastic underground cistern- Byzantine- with Medusa-nice lighting. Ignore the ridiculous push of the Ottoman touristic photo corner etc.

Great family vacation for teens. My boys loved this city more than the other fancier European cities...posibly because it feels like a great adventure! Assign at least 2 FULL days idially 3 or 4...if you are going to other in-countru sites, negotiate your trip with the local travel agencies (tons in the city) and not with your hotel or from the states... local agencies provide the services to all and if you pay them directly you will save at least 40%.

Excellent Architectural History. If you are in a hotel in the Sultanahmet area there is no need for a guided tour for the Blue Mosque, Sophia Haggia, Topkapi Palace, Grand Bazaar and Spice Market. It is pretty safe as of May 2016. You need the same street smarts as in any large city. However you can pick up a guide at the entrance and negotiate a fee. They should have an visible id on them. The only catch would be to determine that the id is genuine. If you must choose, go to the first three which are very close to one another, less than 10 minites. Grand Bazaar is about a 15 minute walk from Topkapi Palace on a pretty safe street or you can take a tram for 4 TL one stop from Sultanahmet. The Spice Market would be two stops on the Tram from the Sultanahmet stop or about at 20 minute walk. After the Spice Market take a boat across from the tram stop for a Bosphorus cruise 12TL. On a rainy day it can be done though not ideal as most of it is indoors.
Just try to be there as long as you can!. Just try to be there as long as you can! walk, watch, eat, drink, smell the history and experience the nice people.

Amazing !. Istanbul City is stunning. You should visit there if you want to come Turkey. You will enjoy and like Istanbul City. Taste traditional foods and drinks in İstanbul. Dishes are delicious really.

Will come back again. Wonderful place where you cank walk, relax, dream, eat, even sleep on the branch. Place where past and present live together. Place which you can visit alone or with family - it would be interesting anyway. Highly recommend for a few days walking. One day for us was not enough.

Amazing! Exceeded my expectations. I truly recommend Istanbul as a destination. You can´t get enough: art, food, culture it is a city to see the contrast between two worlds. We travel with our kids, 10& 12 and they also loved it.

Wow! best place to visit in Istanbul. This place has real charm with historical best places to see in Istanbul, if you passionate about architecture and animosity,its will be a great Exploration about Islamic .. for your life in wonderful city, lots of tourist but still clean, easy to access there get in and out and don't mind to take some time there.love it ...:))

Historical highlights. The old city of Istanbul is by far the most touristic part of the city. Other than some parts of the city this area is clean and well maintained. The old mosques and other buildings are fantastic and a must see in the city. It's easy to spend a day or two in this area if you want to see everything (blue mosque, topkapi palace, hagia sophia, archeological museum, grand bazaar, basilica cistern! Not really the best area for food, although there are exceptions.

Wonderful Istanbul. So many things have been written about all the famous buildings of Istanbul but for me the real charm of this wonderful city is wandering about from area to area on both sides of the Bosphorus and finding charming little hidden gems. Everywhere you go you will be enthralled by the history of this fabulous city.

Amazing city with a dark underside. Istanbul is an amazing city with a dark underbelly. It's sheer size, history and magnitude are breath taking. Well worth spending a few days in. The Turkish people are generally hospitable. It's way of life is however increasingly threatened by the unceasing islamisation of the country. With many native Istanbul residents increasingly fearful for their future.

Basilica Citern . Another world under Istanbul. Very easy to find with comfortable safe steps down and out again. It is not confined and closed areas. One of the best places to see in Istanbul if you are passionate about architecture and history. The building of this enormous structure is mindblowing. It is strongly advised to Google it before you go and view it, as to appreciate it to the fullest. Enjoy your trip into another world below Istanbul...
Beautiful. Chaotic but beautiful to see islamic architecture. Great insights into what makes Turky. Very touristy

Amazing Istanbul. The rich history of Istanbul is reflected in its buildings, people & lifestyle. It is an amazing place to visit & just envelopes you in its spell. It really is where the East meets the West & Istanbul shows you the best of both worlds.

Love this City. It feels very foreign. I've lived in the US and Africa, and traveled to a large number of countries and cities, but this section of the city sounds, smells, looks, and basically feels different, which is glorious (and rare these days) for a tourist. Topkapi palace, Blue Mosque, Ayasofia, Cistern, Grand Bazaar. Old Town is the place to be if you want to time travel to Turkey's glorious history. The treasures collection at the Topkapi palace is breathtaking and definately something you want to see.
Where the east and west meets. Istanbul,is the city of unbelievables.Rich and poor& classic and modernSuperlatives of many directions are there.Nice to visit hard to live
Step back in time. Istanbul got a very specific "feel". Step back in time and history as you walk around in an enormous outdoor museum. Great!

Istanbul is so different. Istanbul is like no other city we've been to. It's fast, many people but so historic. One has seen all the historic buildings in one movie or another.

The heart of Istanbul. We did stay in this area and we did not regret it, very impressive and loved the historic side of it. Although bot very busy nightlife compared to other places in Istanbul, we were travelling with a 2 year old little boy so we did not bother.
Colourful hustle and bustle.. Wonderful area to walk round to get a real feel of this most interesting city. Lots to see and hear in an easily walked area with many locals as well as tourists.

Beautiful historical pllace. Amazing city. Vibrant. clean and friendly people. The tram is the best way to travel and is so cheap. Food is fantastic also if you prefer fast food that is available too.
Amazing City. Had a fantastic week exploring Istanbul. Truly an amazing and now one of my favourite cities to visit.

Too many historic areas in Istanbul to enumerate. Istanbul (erstwhile Constantinople) has so much history it is hard to know where to start. There are historic sights at every corner and in every square. There are numerous Roman era sights but of course given the Byzantine beginnings of this city there are tell tale signs of the origin of this city including the famous Blue Mosque. Wandering around the Spice market, the Grand Bazaar as well as just the narrow streets of the city. The Topkapi palace is a sight to behold but be careful as in any tourist orientated city there can be many a scam. The mighty Bosphorous divides the city into the "historic" Asian part and the "more modern" European part but the city still retains its historic heart.
Очень красиво!Very beautiful. i just like this area, love to be there, eat some streetfood, try their seafood, corn)) dont forget to make lots of photos)

Great place to stroll and see history. Overall the most famous attractions are here. In addition you can find several restaurants and candy shops. The sweets are delicious. If you have trouble walking be advise as this area has hills and steps
Interesting and awesome. You need at least 2 days and the hop on hop off buses are the answer. A beautiful city. Wonderful gardens, heavy traffic and friendly people.

Istanbul has great history and many historical places to visit. Istanbul is place where East meets West and therefore there is an Asian side and European Side and the culture and historical sites on both the sides, which are worth visiting

Places in Istanbul. You should visit Galata tower, Bosphorus area and golden horn.
You should also try the ice cream at galata tower, it's cery delicious.
its awesome. must take the cruise and visit the islands and see the palaces also enjoy the awesome kebabs and icecream

This is what you came to Istanbul for!. History that goes back more than 1000 years, and sometimes much longer. Renovations that bring it back to life, as it was when first created. Coupled with the Grand Bazaar (made in the 6th century) and more other historic areas than you can possibly cover in a week.
If you come to Istanbul, you _must_ go here.
Amazing Walking experience. Istanbul is very accessible by walk.Very good historical trip if you want to learn about ottoman,europe,asia
Another world.... I love my visit to Turkey and would want to go back there. It is a totally different world. I love all the monuments and sites and the history that came with all of them.

Istanbul a Unique Special City Rich in terms of Monuments and History!. I've been several times to Istanbul ( over 20 times since 2007) and each time I return there, I discover more and more about it. Actually, it is a charming city, divided into two parts on both Asia and Europe and this is what makes it a Unique city in the whole world and one of the Best places to visit.Divided by the Bosphorus and surrounded by the Marmara sea and Black sea+ The Golden horn, Istanbul attracts more and more tourists from different countries all over the world.Once there, don't leave without enjoy a cruise to contemplate both sides of the city. Visit Top Kapi Place, Grand Bazar, Blue Mosque with six minarets,Sultan Ahmet, Lallelli ( where you can find hotels ans interesting shops...)Galata Tower is a good place from which you can contemplate the city from the top, it's on Istiklal Avenue, near Taksim square( 30 minutes on foot).There are so many places worth visiting in Istanbul, it's my favourite destination!

Could Be Better . It seems like everyone is raving about this area, but frankly this is over commercialized, chaotic, and unsanitary compared to other leading cities of Europe. The worst experience I had was with the taxi drivers, who would try to cheat you anyway they can. And every vendor and shopkeeper would try to overcharge you. There is no such thing as honest price in places like the Grand Bazaar and the Spice Market. It's a shame that such a place of great historical and cultural importance could be this poorly maintained.
Very interesting. The historical areas in Istanbul give a fascinating insight into the life and times of Turkish people through ages.

Exciting city. Full of culture, history and people. Read up a bit before vist to get the most of it. Look for beledisi (council) restaurant tucked into corner opposite Blue Mosque for value for money.

Nice way to see the Bosphorous. Easy to book the ferry yourself and saves paying for a guided tour which includes the Bosphorous ferry tour. All the attractions ,such as the spice market and mosques are within a short walking distance of each other. All are accessible via the tram system.

Love love love. I love history, so I have enjoyed the history of Istanbul to the max. AMAZING how many stories you will hear and miracles you will see. From Mansions to Mosques to castles to streets.. wooow. I felt like I am living in a fairy tail. But for sure you have to go with a guide or group tour so that you will listen to the details.
I love always our trips to istanbul. We live in sirceci area as always and love the area and the attractions arround. Living by vosporus is always great
Loads to see. A must see city Loads to do and see Even just soaking up the atmosphere Expect to be approached continually but nobody was to aggressive just pushy say no thanks and keep walking

The area to stay and visit. We rode the metro from the airport, passing through areas that would have been unpleasant to stay in. The historic area has palaces, mosques, museums, and markets that are delightful to see and experience. I am pleased to be in the midst of it, looking out at the Bosporus. Everything is in walking distance. The trams and trains are quiet. Ferries are everywhere. Most pleasant!
When you are in Istanbul go to the Grand Bazaar!. My first time in the Grand Bazaar. It was just magnificent. Spices, food, trinkets...Anything you can think of it is there!

Immerse yourself in a part of Europe's millenial history. I've been here three times already and it's one of my favorite spots.You can catch a glimpse of how important the Ottoman and Roman empires were.For a history aficionado it's a part of heaven,

Hagia Sophia Museum. A must in Istanbul! Either you are travelling solo or with company. For business or pleasure. Make the time and take yourself there! Amazing building, great history, breathtaking mosaics. I didn't know that none of the famous Cathedrals of Europe was built when this was erected on this spot by the Byzantine Emperor Justinyen.Closed on Mondays.

Full of history. Just by visiting the historical sites such as the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Grand Bazaar, and Suleymaniye Mosque, you are wandering around the Historical Area of Istanbul. The area pretty much covers the Sultanahmet district.The area is an enjoyable area to wander around and soak up the atmosphere.I went in the first week of May 2016‎, when no tourists wished to visit due to the recent bombings. This meant that the area was not crowded. However, there was a lot of security but was discreet and not in your face. My wife and I felt completely safe without the stress of being in a large crowd of tourists.
Worth it. Nice views, a lot of interesting museums full of history, very good food and not that expansive. You always have something to do and see.

Get lost!. Istanbul is rich of historical area which is attracted everyone to come. Plenty of things that you can do. Endless walk without a map would be great experience if you have brave enough. Overall beautiful place matched with my expectation
SULTANAHMET THE THE PLACE TO BE !!. We stayed at the Aristocrat hotel in the Sultanahmet, which was so close to everything - so it was easy to get around.

Not to be missed. This city is a beautiful and vibrant mix of west and east and I would put it as one of my top places to visit in the world. It is steeped in culture, history and aromas.The Turkish people are friendly and very welcoming to a huge range of visitors. Do not miss the Grand bazaar and spice market and make sure you get to a rooftop restaurant to experience the views across the city and the Bosphorous. A bus tour and boat trip are also a must!Definitely a place to return to.

Istanbul's attractions. Istanbul though the scene of terrorism was fine when I went in May 2016. I travelled by Turkish airlines from UK and it lands close to midnight! The airport is disorganised especially the rude security staff. That way it shows itself as more middle-east than European as people in general are impolite and usually their spoken English is poor. From the airport if your hotel organises it there is a supershuttle service which is great and costs 5 Euros. Otherwise a taxi would cost 15-20 Euros. Public transport is good and they have Tramways and trains running to midnight. You could buy a travelcard for 10 liras and the card price is 6 liras and you can top it up at any station (4 liras=£1) better exchange rates in the market than in banks. Food is a bit bland so I missed my hot food!. I visited without a tour guide and the information here is simply great. I visited the Blue or Sultanmehmet Mosque, its amazingly beautiful; Hagia Sophia which was a Byzantine church built by Constantine then underwent damage, was rebuilt and the converted to a mosque defacing the Christian paintings everywhere to fit in with Islam! Right in the city are two obelisks one belonging to a Pharoah; nearby is the German Fountain given by the Kaiser, The Topkapi Palace is great but if you little time then the most important aspects are the antiquities room housing the bowl used by Abraham, the stick used by Moses, the clothes and flag of the Prophet.....no doubt the queues here are slow moving. The other area is the Harem. Hagia Sophia is getting renovated so! One can take a cruise and I chpose Seth Hatlari for 12 liras that I felt was enough.There is an archaelogical museum, a tile museum. The Bazaar is great and I went to the Spice Bazaar ....the roads parallel to the spice bazaar have a lot of deals and prices better. A museum card for 85 liras is worth it.

Walking with the history.... As if you were in medieval Ottoman age by the walls. Reaching sea is not the most difficult voyage (a quarter hour on foot). Come and see. Riot of colours will be welcoming you at the Grand Bazaar. Be careful in a restaurant on the Galata Bridge against anglers (fishline might hunt the bread on your table).

Fantastic area of Istanbul!. We had a fantastic time in the historic center of Istanbul. There are two things you should definitely keep in mind, however. The first is that shop and restaurant owners can be quite pushy and may try to force you into their establishment before you have even had the chance to look at the menu. I would research restaurants before going out and do not stop anywhere else or make eye contact with the restaurant employees outside. The second is not to trust any local who approaches you to help you outside of any major attraction. We had someone help us outside the Blue Mosque, and we ignorantly accepted his help. He was waiting for us when we exited the mosque, and ushered us into his rug store and tried to pressure us into buying. We were able to get away after a few minutes, but it was still and uncomfortable expereince.

What is there not to be impressed with. Safe, clean, friendly, vibrant, oozing history with friendly people and helpful people. What is there not to like in Istanbul starting from the morning prayer in the early hours of the morning I love it all.

Crowded, long lines,. There are too many brokers working the crowd. Streets are easy walk, but know there are some very high hills to go up. Markets are traditional with plenty of items and plenty of sales people and runners out in the crowds. City is beautiful but sad to see how historical buildings were attempted to be changed.

Very beautiful lot of history & road side shopping. Best thing is to stay in sultan ehmet at Adamar hotel which is very centrally located wear comfortable shoes & walk explore things don't shop from covered market pass by it shop from the galis(lanes) crowded streets they r amazing will get very good prices must visit the animal bazar u will get to see all kind of birds dogs & plants

History and history. This part of the city changed a lot during the last years. But it is still something where you can feel the old centeries. Even there are today a lot of new building and modern tram, this is still the old ottoman empire.

A dreamscape!. I loved the city and could find my way around as if I'd lived there for years. It's easy to get around either on foot (if you don't mind the seven hills!) or by modern tram. It's just one fantastically beautiful building after another. It's so nice to see so much open space, gardens, flowers and people, both local and tourists, enjoying it all!
Visiting Istanbul. Lovely city, lots of history and lovely places to visit - everywhere us also within walking distance of the centre.
Stunning!. Really loved wandering around - some areas being very 'European', others contrasting hugely - we averaged 20km on foot each day...

Beautiful and quiet a lot of history. Istanbul is a history encyclopaedia for anyone interested in Ottoman and roman empire. Beautiful mosques and palaces define the epitome beauty of this lovely city. Give it a try, it will imprint itself in your memories
Beautiful!. Well, the historic Ottoman Empire. Have you ever imagined how was it? You can't even imagine, i can tell you. Go and see for yourselves!
Excellent . Stroll around and enjoy the views as well as the people. Much to discover in every corner. Eat, live, talk,

Self guided tour of Istanbul. Wonderful exciting city. Easy to get around using tram system. All locals very friendly and helpful. Visiting cultural sites made so inviting by local people offering advice and when required dress code. Mosques provided coverups free of charge

Beautiful. Beautiful place but beware of the horrendous prices in the restaurants nearby. Only annoying aspect was the amount of people selling "selfie sticks", roses, and strange glow things. Still completely worth the visit.

sunshine, coffee, walks. Nice narrow streats with plenty of small cafeterias, fancy stylish bars, creative boutiques, shops, galeries, tasty streetfood. History is present on every corner, but the city is bustling and living. Unique atmoshere for walking around.

One of the best cities I've ever been. Nice streets, nice people, good prices, really good food. Feeling incredible mix of East and West . The prayer songs are beautiful. I hope I'll visit this city again.

Nice, but crowded. I loved visiting Istanbul, but try to go there in the middle of the week when there are fewer tourists. Also try walking on random streets around the historic area because they are so pretty!

Going back to medieval times.... Walking around this area is a true experience. Like in Rome, you really feel the medieval soul here. The houses, people, streets, food and atmosphere are as life is meant to be...

1500 Years of History at Arms Length. We stayed at a charming small hotel (Empress Zoe) in the heart of the old City within walking distance of Hagia Sophia Museum and the Blue Mosque. Despite all the ambience and history enveloping us we did not confine ourselves to the old City. It is a great base for exploring Istanbul wide and far and after lingering over a sumptuous breakfast buffet at our hotel and fortifying ourselves with great Turkish coffee we walked seven to 10 miles a day throughout Istanbul. A great European City!

Do it with cruise . This tour should be do it by cruise. There are two types of cruises one is operated by government which carries around 200 people and another is private which carries around 20-30 people. I will suggest take private one and most importantly do BARGAINING. You will able to see Asian side as well as European side of Istanbul. The total journey time is around 2hrs.

A lovely education!. A ride on the Bosphorus is a breathtaking experience; full of history, wonder and relaxation. In addition, enjoy leisurely walks throughout the historic neighborhoods of Istanbul!
Safe and friendly area to wander in. I was struck by the courtesy of the Turkish people, especially when I tried speaking bad Turkish. At 62 I always got a seat on the tram!

Historic Istanbul. The old city of Istanbul is wonderful. I found it a great pleasure to walk a lot to see the sites and to take many good quality photographs. There are a huge number of very interesting places to visit. There is the Grand Bazaar, the Blue Mosque, the Spice Market and the Gelata Bridge underneath which there are many wonderful fish restaurants. The fish meals in these restaurants is very good and tasty. The hold city is a place not to miss. However, be careful with the taxi drivers who can con you out of a lot of money.

Must do. Visited with a friend who is local to istanbul. Traffic is a disaster so take the tramway to get around. A great walking visit of the historical areas, bazars and mosques. Most bazar sellers speak english and you should expect to bargain for most wares.

Get lost wandering the streets :). I solo traveled Istanbul and had a glorious time. Every morning (map in hand) I'd head off to a tourist attraction and took thousands of photos, chatted to locals and marvelled at the historic beauty that is Istanbul.
Beautiful.. Beautiful scenery; can be extremely crowded during weekend. The restaurants under the Galata Bridge is a nice point to refresh yourself.
Central. İf u r traveling to istanbul ,be sure that ur hotel is located in the old town that u can walk everywhere and dont need tour...

lovely atmosphere. When we where there they had the biggest carpet of tulips as well as live entertainment and a little craft market, beautifully maintained and pretty fountains and trees. enough seating areas and the food carts outside are not over priced as you would come to expect from a tourist destination

WHAT AN EXPERIENCE!. I've traveled quite extensively throughout Europe, Asia, Africa and North America, and can't think of any place offering anything comparable to the richness and diversity of historic Istanbul. Whether you have 3 days or 30 days to spare, you must put this on your must-see list -- at least once in your lifetime. The incredible friendliness of the people, completely safe environment, and excellent public transport facilities are huge bonuses.

I felt very safe here April 2016. Not many tourists in Istanbul because of recent terrorist events,so the major sights are fairly empty and the locals are finding it hard. There is a police presence everywhere and bags are checked as are people at all the major sights.

Walk to see!. I spent 9 days walking around Istanbul (around 100 miles in all) which I understand is probably not what you’re planning. However, getting out on foot in the morning especially can change the way you see Istanbul, even if just for one day. I traveled in March and had good weather (mostly sunny days with scattered rain). From my experience I can say that walking from place to place is a wonderful way to experience Istanbul, even (and especially) the Historic areas. So many wonders lie behind the great Mosques and Bazaars. Getting "lost" in the tiny, hilly streets around the Egyptian Market, the Grand Bazaar, and in Sultanahmet adds a different perspective to the historical buildings. If you start early, you'll be walking the streets with the vendors, market workers and (probably) polis. Of course, just walking around without a tour guide gives you more time to take pictures, interact with locals, and quietly observe. I was fortunate enough to have alone time in many Mosques, be the first tourist in Hagia Sophia in the morning, and have candid conversation with Grand Bazaar vendors before the crowds arrive. I started my days at a leisurely 7:30am, using Istanbul’s fantastic public transit to take me to a starting point. You can read all the other reviews for what to look at and why to visit, of course. How you experience Istanbul will color your impression of it. If you are guided everywhere, or only go out and about in the crowded afternoons and early evenings, you might find the Historic Area to be more like a European Mall than a UNESCO World Heritage Site. But with a little patience (and a lot of walking up and down steep hills) you can find awe. I did!

Istanbul is wonderful even in all these tourist filled areas.. So many beautiful mosques to see. You must do it all. Wander to different neighborhoods and the palace and take the ferry to the Asian side.

So much to see and do, we wished we had more time. The fact that the city is on two Continents is unique and gave me my first visit to Asia.

A mesmerizing mix of Byzantine and Ottoman! . The historical center of Istanbul is one of the most interesting place I have ever visited during my 35 years of travel. Unlike other European city centers this has far more character because of it's Byzantine and Ottoman legacy. You can see the Ottoman Blue Mosque across the Byzantine Hagia Sofia, you can see the Roman Basilica Cistern in front of the Turkish Fountains, you can see the Ibrahim Pasa Palace overlooking the Roman Hippodrome and the Egyptian Obelisk. This area is brimming with mosques, palaces, museums, monuments, bazaars, hamams, cobbled streets and kebab shops. No wonder it is called the World Capital as this is the center from where two great civilizations were ruled.

Longer but superb walk. If you have time and love to observe the culture in the city, historic areas of Istanbul are possible to walk through. You can't walk everywhere in one day, but in few days easily.
good artistic buildings. i love the architecture of the building with its historical meaning and more good roads to this place much love for the historical site

Exotic, Exciting, Incredible, Istanbul. WOW! Where to begin in this magic beautiful world class city? On the must see list is: The Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, Grand Bazaar, Basilica Cistern, Spice Market, Suleymaniye Mosque and so much more. Don't forget a ferry ride and explore the city on the tram too. Wander the streets to enjoy the atmosphere.

Incredible sights and beautiful people. The Sultanahmet area is centred around The Hippodrome; an open-air, Roman-era site, which for centuries was the site of chariot races and Egyptian obelisks remain. The iconic Byzantine Hagia Sophia features a soaring dome and Christian mosaics and The Blue Mosque are all alongside the Hippodrome.
Istanbul is such a historically rich city!. Istanbul is one of the most historical cities in the world! I highly recommend seeing all of the historic places in one or two days!

Plunge into a dream of 1001 nights. stroll anytime of the day, preferably in the evening hours and enjoy what was built 2000 years ago. Lovely: watch the sea gulls gliding around the domes of the blue mosque and LOVE the bazar...
wow sightseeing. taking ride around istanbul on up and low street is a great experience , buitiful building around ,too good

Seeing exotic sites. The whole area of Istanbul is bursting with history and new things to see. Whether you go to the spice market (so much to see, don't get lost) taking a trip on the Bosporus or visiting one of the many historical sites there is so much to see.
all the attrations are close by. you can see all the historic places in one day and are within walking distance. Interesting history - a mix of east and west, Christianity and Islam.

attractive places that you don't like leaving. A must visit destination. I have been trying to get to Istanbul for 40 years. Our first trip there was canceled by a cruise line.
